message.content: This question requires an understanding of electrical connections and the effects of electricity on materials. When a light is turned on, it is connected to wiring, which conducts electricity. The flow of electricity through the wiring can cause it to heat up, leading to a feeling of toasty warmth. Option (A) is incorrect because wiring is not shredded when a light is turned on. Option (C) is incorrect because wiring is typically made of metal, not wood. Option (D) is unrelated to electrical connections and does not make sense in this context.

This question requires basic knowledge about the functionality of a light bulb and wiring. When a light is turned on, it is connected to wiring that allows electricity to flow and illuminate the bulb. Option (A) is incorrect because wiring is not designed to be shredded when a light is turned on. Option (C) is incorrect because wiring is typically made of metal, not wood. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no reason for wiring to be icy when a light is turned on. Option (B) is the correct answer because when electricity flows through wiring, it can generate heat, causing the wiring to feel toasty.
